leads.lead_text: Perianth to c. 3 mm diam., lacking involucral bracts; prostrate herb with perennial rootstock; native, chiefly northern
Perianth 2 cm or more in diam., subtended by 5 sepal-like involucral bracts; erect herb to c. 1 m high; garden-escape
